00019 #ifndef __UTIL_THREAD_H__
00020 #define __UTIL_THREAD_H__
00021 
00022 #include <boost/thread.hpp>
00023 #include <pthread.h>
00024 #include <queue>
00025 
00026 #include "util_function.h"
00027 
00028 CCL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
00029 
00030 /* use boost for mutexes */
00031 
00032 typedef boost::mutex thread_mutex;
00033 typedef boost::mutex::scoped_lock thread_scoped_lock;
00034 typedef boost::condition_variable thread_condition_variable;
00035 
00036 /* own pthread based implementation, to avoid boost version conflicts with
00037    dynamically loaded blender plugins */
00038 
00039 class thread {
00040 public:
00041     thread(boost::function<void(void)> run_cb_)
00042     {
00043         joined = false;
00044         run_cb = run_cb_;
00045 
00046         pthread_create(&pthread_id, NULL, run, (void*)this);
00047     }
00048 
00049     ~thread()
00050     {
00051         if(!joined)
00052             join();
00053     }
00054 
00055     static void *run(void *arg)
00056     {
00057         ((thread*)arg)->run_cb();;
00058         return NULL;
00059     }
00060 
00061     bool join()
00062     {
00063         return pthread_join(pthread_id, NULL) == 0;
00064     }
00065 
00066 protected:
00067     boost::function<void(void)> run_cb;
00068     pthread_t pthread_id;
00069     bool joined;
00070 };
00071 
00072 /* Thread Safe Queue to pass tasks from one thread to another. Tasks should be
00073  * pushed into the queue, while the worker thread waits to pop the next task
00074  * off the queue. Once all tasks are into the queue, calling stop() will stop
00075  * the worker threads from waiting for more tasks once all tasks are done. */
00076 
00077 template<typename T> class ThreadQueue
00078 {
00079 public:
00080     ThreadQueue()
00081     {
00082         tot = 0;
00083         tot_done = 0;
00084         do_stop = false;
00085         do_cancel = false;
00086     }
00087 
00088     /* Main thread functions */
00089 
00090     /* push a task to be executed */
00091     void push(const T& value)
00092     {
00093         thread_scoped_lock lock(queue_mutex);
00094         queue.push(value);
00095         tot++;
00096         lock.unlock();
00097 
00098         queue_cond.notify_one();
00099     }
00100 
00101     /* wait until all tasks are done */
00102     void wait_done()
00103     {
00104         thread_scoped_lock lock(done_mutex);
00105 
00106         while(tot_done != tot)
00107             done_cond.wait(lock);
00108     }
00109 
00110     /* stop all worker threads */
00111     void stop()
00112     {
00113         clear();
00114         do_stop = true;
00115         queue_cond.notify_all();
00116     }
00117 
00118     /* cancel all tasks, but keep worker threads running */
00119     void cancel()
00120     {
00121         clear();
00122         do_cancel = true;
00123         wait_done();
00124         do_cancel = false;
00125     }
00126 
00127     /* Worker thread functions
00128      *
00129      * while(queue.worker_wait_pop(task)) {
00130      *      for(..) {
00131      *          ... do work ...
00132      *
00133      *          if(queue.worker_cancel())
00134      *              break;
00135      *      }
00136      *      
00137      *      queue.worker_done();
00138      * }
00139      */
00140 
00141     bool worker_wait_pop(T& value)
00142     {
00143         thread_scoped_lock lock(queue_mutex);
00144 
00145         while(queue.empty() && !do_stop)
00146             queue_cond.wait(lock);
00147 
00148         if(queue.empty())
00149             return false;
00150         
00151         value = queue.front();
00152         queue.pop();
00153 
00154         return true;
00155     }
00156 
00157     void worker_done()
00158     {
00159         thread_scoped_lock lock(done_mutex);
00160         tot_done++;
00161         lock.unlock();
00162 
00163         assert(tot_done <= tot);
00164 
00165         done_cond.notify_all();
00166     }
00167 
00168     bool worker_cancel()
00169     {
00170         return do_cancel;
00171     }
00172 
00173 protected:
00174     void clear()
00175     {
00176         thread_scoped_lock lock(queue_mutex);
00177 
00178         while(!queue.empty()) {
00179             thread_scoped_lock done_lock(done_mutex);
00180             tot_done++;
00181             done_lock.unlock();
00182 
00183             queue.pop();
00184         }
00185 
00186         done_cond.notify_all();
00187     }
00188 
00189     std::queue<T> queue;
00190     thread_mutex queue_mutex;
00191     thread_mutex done_mutex;
00192     thread_condition_variable queue_cond;
00193     thread_condition_variable done_cond;
00194     volatile bool do_stop;
00195     volatile bool do_cancel;
00196     volatile int tot, tot_done;
00197 };
00198 
00199 /* Thread Local Storage
00200  *
00201  * Boost implementation is a bit slow, and Mac OS X __thread is not supported
00202  * but the pthreads implementation is optimized, so we use these macros. */
00203 
00204 #ifdef __APPLE__
00205 
00206 #define tls_ptr(type, name) \
00207     pthread_key_t name
00208 #define tls_set(name, value) \
00209     pthread_setspecific(name, value)
00210 #define tls_get(type, name) \
00211     ((type*)pthread_getspecific(name))
00212 #define tls_create(type, name) \
00213     pthread_key_create(&name, NULL)
00214 #define tls_delete(type, name) \
00215     pthread_key_delete(name);
00216 
00217 #else
00218 
00219 #ifdef __WIN32
00220 #define __thread __declspec(thread)
00221 #endif
00222 
00223 #define tls_ptr(type, name) \
00224     __thread type *name
00225 #define tls_set(name, value) \
00226     name = value
00227 #define tls_get(type, name) \
00228     name
00229 #define tls_create(type, name)
00230 #define tls_delete(type, name)
00231 
00232 #endif
00233 
00234 CCL_NAMESPACE_END
00235 
00236 #endif /* __UTIL_THREAD_H__ */
